metadata.title: Impact of AI Feedback on Professional Skills Development
metadata.subtitle: Evidence from the London School of Economics Skills Accelerator Program

abstract.summary: This study explores the impact of AI-generated feedback on student learning outcomes, skill development, and professional readiness within the London School of Economics (LSE) Skills Accelerator program. Findings reveal statistically significant improvements in collaboration, problem-solving, innovation, cultural intelligence, and data science skills.

keyFindings.description: High student satisfaction with the learning and industry project
Statistically significant self-assessed skill improvements in collaboration, problem-solving, innovation, cultural intelligence, and data science skills
Strong recognition from industry clients on prepareness, and professionalism, communication skills, and technical competency

collaboration.narrative: Students reported statistically significant improvements in teamwork and conflict resolution abilities, with AI feedback rated 4.3/5 in constructiveness.
feedback: I think the theoretical base was very useful, and the simulation as well in having AI-generated feedback to understand the weaknesses and strengths of my responses.

It was a very constructive module, including both theoretical and practical exercises which really helped me in fully understanding the module and ensuring that I am correctly applying it in practical settings.

I think the module was very effective at covering the main aspects of conflict management during teamwork and highlighting how many aspects need to be considered in order for a team to be successful and the work to go to plan.

The module provided comprehensive insights and practical techniques for enhancing collaboration. These insights were actionable and applicable to real-world scenarios, which greatly contributed to my understanding and improvement in collaboration. The module's structured approach, clear examples, and emphasis on continuous improvement were particularly beneficial in developing practical skills that I can apply in various professional settings.
This module helped me to gain a better understanding of ways in which I can develop my collaboration skills and situations in which I may encounter use for them.
improvements: It would be helpful to have accompanying transcripts for the videos. Especially for the longer videos.
The content could be split into even more modules.
Incorporate more real-world case studies and simulations that allow participants to apply collaborative skills in varied and complex scenarios.

It is useful and insightful, but I am not sure it reflects all different working environment in different countries. To be honest, Asian workplace is quite top-down and more relatively conservative, so it would be difficult to apply some strategies introduced in this module.
It is indeed too long, I got a little bored and I am a master's student with a dissertation to write, I would appreciate something quicker.

problemSolving.narrative: 15% gain in critical thinking skills, with scores rising from 4.2 to 4.7 on adaptability.
feedback: The module was highly effective in strengthening my problem-solving abilities, particularly due to the practical exercises and real-world application scenarios that helped me understand the complexities of problems in a business context.

This module with the real-life simulation is really helpful in terms of letting me fully understand the importance of problem-solving. In addition, the module is designed interactively and creatively.

It can be deemed as a systematic training that helped me to know how I can help solve real-life business challenges. By following the instructions step by step, I am now clear about how professional consultants work to solve business challenges and how to apply my critical thinking skills beyond academia and into practice.

The module's balance of theoretical knowledge and practical application, along with opportunities for reflection and feedback, made the learning experience highly engaging and enriching. This holistic approach not only improved my problem-solving skills but also my overall strategic thinking and adaptability in dynamic environments.
The simulation was a great learning tool to combine learning and practice!
improvements: There could be different case studies used instead of just the one.
Allowing for more utilization of the models being provided.
It is better to provide a case with some hands-on data.
Could benefit from more theory on ways to address problem-solving strategies.
It would be beneficial to include more interactive exercises or case studies to further apply the problem-solving frameworks in different scenarios.

innovation.narrative: 12% increase in ability to present innovative ideas effectively, with pre- to post-assessment scores improving from 3.9 to 4.4.
feedback: Before I was very unconfident in producing any solution solely by myself, but now I can see a clear method of approaching it.

I provided a high rating for this module because it offered a well-rounded approach to innovation development. The structured problem-solving framework was instrumental in honing my analytical skills, while the emphasis on creativity and divergent thinking sparked fresh perspectives.

The module's focus on resilience and adaptability resonated with the challenges of real-world problem-solving. Practical applications, like pitching ideas and using the Value Proposition Canvas, added a hands-on dimension.

This module was highly effective in developing my innovation skills because it provided a structured approach to problem-solving and idea generation. The hands-on tasks and real-world examples made the concepts easy to understand and apply, significantly enhancing my ability to create viable and impactful solutions.
This is my first task of this nature, and I now know how to refine my ideas and understand the importance of working from consumer feedback.
improvements: It would be good to include more case studies.
It was effective in developing this skill for me in a logical and methodological way, but I wish I could have seen more case studies along the way, as this would have been very helpful.
Including case studies and analyzing successful and unsuccessful startups. Including examples of how innovation is used in the workplace, rather than only when coming up with new business ideas.

I found the feedback useful and incorporated it to make changes to the remaining assessments for this module as I went on. The only reason I wouldn't rate it a 5 would be because I prefer to engage in face-to-face learning rather than pre-recorded videos.

culturalIntelligence.narrative: Significant improvements in cultural awareness and adaptability, crucial for diverse professional environments.
feedback: It has clear examples and points out many things I had not considered nor systematically investigated before, which opens a new aspect to be mindful about.
My knowledge of cultural intelligence improved and there was a regular application to real-life situations.
It expanded my understanding of what cultural intelligence actually entails.
The concrete exercise with the exemplar was very useful in providing a practical example of what cross-cultural business may look like.
It's very useful as it provides various scenarios that we are likely to meet in our future work. It's a good way to practice my intercultural communication abilities with real-life examples.
improvements: It would be nice if there could be examples of cultural differences to show how people from different places behave and think.
I wish it would have provided more information on a wider variety of cultures.
Incorporate more interactive simulations or case studies to apply Cultural Intelligence in real-world scenarios.
If the module provides practical examples which are really difficult to deal with as a beginner worker, it would be more useful for us.

dataScience.narrative: Notable improvements in data analysis skills and ability to present data-driven insights.
feedback: It definitely took me out of my comfort zone because my degree deals largely with qualitative information, and I personally prefer that. But it was also really interesting because of that.
More difficult than other modules, but was really insightful to see how these processes work.
Although challenging, I found it immensely helpful.

The module provided hands-on experience with data analysis techniques that are directly applicable in professional settings. The practical exercises and feedback helped solidify my understanding and skills.
I had the opportunity to get in touch with a lot of knowledge that I haven't learned before in class.
improvements: I feel that it jumped from very basic to slightly too advanced, and there was no stepping stone in between to help with that.

It would be great to have a suggestion of length for each written question. A large amount of my AI feedback was that my response wasn't detailed enough, but I had assumed we only needed one-sentence answers.
The module was well-structured and comprehensive. Perhaps including more case studies or real-world business scenarios could further enhance the application of data analysis skills.

I feel that the module would be more interactive if there is more input required for some lines of code, even if it is small. It really encourages the student to look and familiarize themselves with the new information.

recommendations.description: Implement more detailed tracking of AI feedback interactions
Develop AI algorithms that adjust feedback based on individual progress
Implement long-term tracking of career outcomes

limitations.description: Limited generalizability due to sample size
Short-term study may not capture long-term effects
Participants who opt into AI-enhanced programs may have different characteristics
Initial positive responses may be influenced by technology novelty

references.author: Vygotsky, L. S.
references.title: Mind in Society: The Development of Higher Psychological Processes
references.relevance: Vygotsky introduces the concept of the Zone of Proximal Development, emphasizing the importance of social interaction and scaffolding in cognitive development.

references.author: Bandura, A.
references.title: Self-efficacy: The Exercise of Control
references.relevance: Bandura discusses the concept of self-efficacy and its role in human motivation and behavior, highlighting how belief in one's capabilities influences actions and outcomes.

references.author: Duckworth, A. L., Peterson, C., Matthews, M. D., & Kelly, D. R.
references.title: Grit: Perseverance and Passion for Long-Term Goals
references.journal: Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
references.relevance: This seminal paper introduces the concept of 'grit' as a predictor of success, emphasizing the importance of perseverance and sustained passion in achieving long-term objectives.

references.author: Evans, C.
references.title: Making Sense of Assessment Feedback in Higher Education
references.relevance: Evans reviews the role of feedback in higher education, discussing how effective feedback practices can enhance student learning and professional skill development.

references.author: Hattie, J., & Timperley, H.
references.title: The Power of Feedback
references.relevance: This article examines the impact of feedback on learning achievement, presenting a model that emphasizes the importance of feedback in driving student progress.

references.author: Gibbs, G., & Simpson, C.
references.title: Conditions Under Which Assessment Supports Students' Learning
references.journal: Learning and Teaching in Higher Education
references.relevance: Gibbs and Simpson analyze the conditions needed for assessment to effectively support learning, highlighting the crucial role of timely and constructive feedback.

references.author: Carless, D., Salter, D., Yang, M., & Lam, J.
references.title: Developing Sustainable Feedback Practices
references.relevance: This paper explores strategies for creating sustainable feedback practices in higher education, emphasizing the need for feedback that is meaningful, actionable, and promotes self-regulated learning.

references.author: Jonassen, D. H.
references.title: Toward a Design Theory of Problem Solving
references.relevance: Jonassen proposes a design theory for problem-solving instruction, focusing on how learning environments can be structured to enhance learners' problem-solving skills.

references.author: Means, B., Murphy, R., & Bakia, M.
references.title: Learning Online: What Research Tells Us About Whether, When and How
references.relevance: This book reviews research on online learning, discussing the effectiveness of online education and providing insights on how and when it can best be implemented.

references.author: Lin, Y., et al.
references.title: IMBUE: Improving Interpersonal Effectiveness through Simulation and Just-in-time Feedback with Human-Language Model Interaction
references.journal: Proceedings of the 62nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
references.relevance: The study presents IMBUE, an interactive training system that utilizes language models to simulate communication scenarios and provide immediate feedback, focusing on enhancing interpersonal effectiveness.

references.author: AlGhamdi, A.
references.title: Exploring the Impact of ChatGPT-Generated Feedback on Student Writing Skills
references.relevance: This research examines how AI-generated feedback, specifically from ChatGPT, influences the writing skills of first-year computing students, finding positive effects on writing proficiency and engagement.

references.author: Mahapatra, D.
references.title: Empowering Soft Skills through Artificial Intelligence and Personalized Tutoring
references.relevance: This study analyzes how integrating AI tools with personalized tutoring affects the development of soft skills in university students, suggesting that combining AI with human interaction enhances competencies in areas like communication and problem-solving.
